title: Maryport to Allonby Walk Route

images.title: Maryport Harbour by John Lucas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Maryport Harbour

images.title: Phil Davies / Maryport Promenade, just after high tide
images.caption: Maryport Promenade, just after high tide. The promenade offers a sociable walk, about 2km each way. This picture was taken just below the Roman Museum; it wasn't a particularly high tide. This is a good location for spotting cetaceans in the Solway if the sea surface is calm. They may be so far out that it is very hard to see them with the naked eye, so it's worth taking binoculars for cetecean and bird spotting.

images.title: Parking area by Crosscanonby beach by Rose and Trev Clough, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Parking area by Crosscanonby beach

images.title: Bob Jenkins / Stony beach, near Swarthy Hill
images.caption: Stony beach, near Swarthy Hill. There is a great variety of beach materials along the Solway coast; here, close to the shore, is a stretch of water-worn rounded rocks, further out is clean sand, a couple of km away is exposed sandstone bedrock.

images.title: Andy Mitchell from Glasgow, UK, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Solway Firth

images.caption: A view of Allonby from the south

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Footpath to the beach at Allonby
images.caption: Footpath to the beach at Allonby

description: This walk follows a popular section of the Cumbria Coastal Way from Maryport to Allonby. The route runs for a distance of 5.5 miles along a fairly flat path on the Solway Coast. On the way you will pass and old Roman Tower, Swarthy Hill and the settlements of Crosby and Crosscanonby. There are some splendid views across Allonby Bay to the Solway Firth. You can extend the walk by continuing north along the coast path to Mawbray and Silloth .
display_address: Marine Road, Ewanrigg, Maryport, Cumberland, England, CA15 8BD, United Kingdom
